components.description: The letter S, which can be used as part of a regional indicator pair to create emoji flags for various countries.
components.title: Regional Indicator Symbol Letter S

components.description: The letter J, which can be used as part of a regional indicator pair to create emoji flags for various countries.
components.title: Regional Indicator Symbol Letter J

description: The flag for Svalbard & Jan Mayen, which may show as the letters SJ on some platforms. This is the same flag as Norway.
title: Flag: Svalbard & Jan Mayen

emoji_net_data.definition: The flag for Svalbard & Jan Mayen, which may show as the lettersÂ SJÂ on some platforms.Â This is the same flag asÂ Norway. The Flag for Svalbar http://emojipedia.org/flag-for-svalbard-jan-mayen/
emoji_net_data.name: Svalbard & Jan Mayen

bn:00034960n: Emblem usually consisting of a rectangular piece of cloth of distinctive design
A flag is a piece of fabric with a distinctive design that is used as a symbol, as a signaling device, or as decoration.
A piece of cloth, often decorated with an emblem, used as a visual signal or symbol.
Piece of fabric with a distinctive design

bn:01539619n: Two distinct dependencies of Norway. Official name: Svalbard and Jan Mayen Islands.
Two parts of Norway under separate jurisdictions
Svalbard and Jan Mayen is a statistical designation defined by ISO 3166-1 of two parts of Norway under separate jurisdictions -- Svalbard and Jan Mayen.

bn:01004782n: The flag of Norway is red with an indigo blue Scandinavian cross fimbriated in white that extends to the edges of the flag; the vertical part of the cross is shifted to the hoist side in the style of the Dannebrog, the flag of Denmark.

note: This emoji was found in merged_emojis_before_fluentui but not in FluentUI
